body_html:
@drpngx Thanks for the hint. I fixed the indentation and the //tensorflow/python:contrib_test now passes on my machine.

How do TensorFlow's contributors check the indentation? I ran pylint with TensorFlow's pylintrc on my code before committing but it didn't catch the wrong indentation. The Google Python Style Guide also doesn't mention it.
body_text:
@drpngx Thanks for the hint. I fixed the indentation and the //tensorflow/python:contrib_test now passes on my machine.
How do TensorFlow's contributors check the indentation? I ran pylint with TensorFlow's pylintrc on my code before committing but it didn't catch the wrong indentation. The Google Python Style Guide also doesn't mention it.
body:
@drpngx Thanks for the hint. I fixed the indentation and the `//tensorflow/python:contrib_test` now passes on my machine. 

How do TensorFlow's contributors check the indentation? I ran `pylint` with TensorFlow's [`pylintrc`](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/tools/ci_build/pylintrc) on my code before committing but it didn't catch the wrong indentation. The [Google Python Style Guide](https://google.github.io/styleguide/pyguide.html) also doesn't mention it.
